items.text: length ball, on middle, and pulled along the ground to deep backward square. Races away. That's 5000 ODI runs as wicketkeeper as well
items.shortText: Rankin to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: sharp take from the keeper! Breaks the partnership. Full on middle, and going down leg. Mushfiqur tries to flick, but it takes his glove and Wilson dives to his left to take a one-handed stunner
items.postText: mahfuj: "tv shows shakib 43(42) but you shows 44(42) which is true mate" -- our scorers have the accurate numbers

dismissal.text: Mushfiqur Rahim c †Wilson b Rankin 35 (33b 5x4 0x6) SR: 106.06

items.text: length ball on middle, and nudged off his hips to the leg side
items.postText: Mustafizur Rahm: "This was a chance for BD to send Sabbir instead of Mahmudullah"

items.text: full, on off, and tapped back to the bowler
items.postText: Faisal Sahul Ha: "World cup is coming: no offence England: Children of forest (inventors of the game but never sat on the throne) Australia: Lannisters (pay back quite harshly) India: Starks (one man show? family?) Pakistan: Targaryens (Very unpredictable) South Africa- Ser Jorah (always gets disappointed) New Zealand: Jon snow (never really ready to sit on the throne) Bangladesh: Men beyond the wall (Very emotional) Sri Lanka: Brandon Stark (No one knows what they are doing)"
items.shortText: Rankin to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: full, on middle, and tapped towards the keeper. Nearly played on!
items.postText: Abhijato: "Will we see the ESPNCricinfo Forecaster at this World Cup?" -- Yes, sir
items.shortText: Rankin to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: full, just outside off, and defended towards cover for a quick single
length ball, on off, and nudged off his pads to the leg side
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: full, on off, and defended back to the bowler
length ball, on off, and angling in. Punched with the bat's open face to the gap near deep extra cover
full, on off, and defended towards the leg side. They scamper across for one
full, on leg stump, and worked off his pads for a quick single
items.postText:
sri: "being a ireland fan this is very sad for me bcoz after scoring 327 they are not able to win. today also they are struggling to taking wicket & maintaining runrate .mostly more than 270 is superb total in ODI. but my favourite team struggling...come on love u from india"

Abdullah Al mus: "Do you know what is hope?my comments will publish.and what is frustration?still it will not publish.come on Cricinfo!!let me say hurrah!! finally!! Yes!!"
items.shortText: Dockrell to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: length ball, on off, and worked off his hips to the leg side
items.shortText: Little to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on off, and pulled behind square to deep backward square
good length, on off, and pulled to deep backward square
items.shortText: Little to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: bit of a strain for Shakib.
items.text: length ball, just outside off, and the attempted pull is inside-edged to point
pulled over deep midwicket! Back of a length, and he swivels to pull over the boundary-line
length ball, just outside off, and cut square to point
items.postText: That's all from me tonight. Here's Shashank to take you through till the end

items.text: slower and fuller on off, pushed into the covers
items.postText: Bangladesh fans, calm down. Shakib seems okay.
items.shortText: McCarthy to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: flays this through to sweeper cover
items.shortText: McCarthy to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: beaten as he looks to steer this square
deflects off the thigh pad to the fine leg boundary, wanted to pull but missed
worked to deep midwicket as they jog the single
cut away down to square third man
items.postText: Breaking: Shakib is leaving the field, retired hurt. Possible that this is a precautionary measure. We'll let you know as and when we find out details. For those wondering what the injury is: it's a side strain.
items.shortText: McCarthy to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

dismissal.text: Shakib Al Hasan retired hurt 50 (51b 4x4 0x6) SR: 98.03

items.text: beaten as he looks to ease this behind point
items.shortText: Little to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: stands tall and defends
